com.petgame.ui

Class Pet

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.petgame.ui.Pet
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultPet, Furfrou, Magearna, Tyrunt

    public abstract class Pet
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract base class representing a virtual pet with various attributes and behaviors. Handles the pet's name, points, health, fullness, sleep, happiness, sprites, and states. Provides functionality for managing pet stats over time.

      • Pet

        public Pet(java.lang.String name,
           GameManager gm)

      • Pet

        public Pet(java.lang.String name,
           int points,
           int healthCur,
           int healthMax,
           int fullnessCur,
           int fullnessMax,
           int sleepCur,
           java.lang.String state,
           int sleepMax,
           int happinessCur,
           int happinessMax,
           java.lang.Long lastVet,
           java.lang.Long lastExercise,
           java.lang.Long lastPlay,
           GameManager gm)
        Constructs a new Pet object with specified stats and attributes.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the pet.
        points - The current point score of the pet.
        healthCur - The current health value of the pet.
        healthMax - The maximum health value of the pet.
        fullnessCur - The current fullness value of the pet.
        fullnessMax - The maximum fullness value of the pet.
        sleepCur - The current sleep value of the pet.
        state - The current state of the pet (e.g., "normal", "angry", "hungry").
        sleepMax - The maximum sleep value of the pet.
        happinessCur - The current happiness value of the pet.
        happinessMax - The maximum happiness value of the pet.
        lastVet - The last timestamp the pet visited the vet.
        lastExercise - The last timestamp the pet exercised.
        lastPlay - The last timestamp the pet played.
        gm - The GameManager instance managing the pet's lifecycle and state.

        public void decreaseStats(java.lang.String statType)

      • checkState

        public void checkState()
        Checks the state and decreases the specified stat type over time based on the pet's current state.

      • sleep

        public int sleep()
        Makes the pet sleep until its sleep is fully restored, locking it into a "sleep" state during the process.

        This method changes the pet's state to "sleep" and gradually increases its sleep meter until it reaches the maximum value. While the pet is sleeping, it cannot perform any other actions. Points are awarded based on the duration of sleep completed.

        If the pet is dead, the method returns -1. If the pet is in a restricted state (e.g., angry or already sleeping), it returns -2.

        Returns:
        The amount of sleep gained if successful. Returns:
        • A positive integer representing the amount of sleep gained.
        • -1 if the pet is dead.
        • -2 if the pet is in a restricted state (e.g., "angry" or "sleep").

      • play

        public int play()
        Initiates a play session with the pet, increasing its happiness if successful.

        This method checks if a cooldown period has passed since the last play session. If so, the pet's happiness increases by a fixed amount, and points are awarded. If the cooldown is not yet over, the method returns -3.

        If the pet is dead, the method returns -1.

        Returns:
        The amount of happiness gained if successful. Returns:
        • A positive integer representing the amount of happiness gained.
        • -1 if the pet is dead.
        • -3 if the command is on cooldown.

      • takeVet

        public int takeVet()
        Takes the pet to the vet to restore health, with a cooldown period of 20 minutes between visits.

        This method increases the pet's health by a fixed amount. Points are deducted as a cost for the vet visit. If the cooldown period has not passed, the method returns -3. If the pet is dead or angry, appropriate status codes are returned.

        Returns:
        The amount of health gained if successful. Returns:
        • A positive integer representing the amount of health gained.
        • -1 if the pet is dead.
        • -2 if the pet is angry.
        • -3 if the command is on cooldown.

      • giveItem

        public int giveItem(Item item)
        Gives an item to the pet to increase its fullness and happiness.

        This method applies the effects of an item to the pet. If the item is food, the pet must not be in an angry state. Otherwise, the pet's fullness and happiness are updated based on the item's properties. Points are also awarded.

        If the pet is dead, the method returns -1. If the pet is angry and the item is food, it returns -2.

        Parameters:
        item - The item to be given to the pet.
        Returns:
        Returns:
        • 0 if the item is successfully applied.
        • -1 if the pet is dead.
        • -2 if the pet is angry and the item is food.

      • exercise

        public int exercise(Inventory inv)
        Exercises the pet, improving its health but reducing fullness and sleepiness.

        This method improves the pet's health and awards points, but decreases fullness and sleepiness by fixed amounts. It also randomly awards an item from a predefined list of items, which is added to the inventory.

        If the cooldown period of 20 minutes has not passed, the method returns -3. If the pet is dead or angry, appropriate status codes are returned.

        Parameters:
        inv - The inventory to which the randomly awarded item will be added.
        Returns:
        The amount of health gained if successful. Returns:
        • A positive integer representing the amount of health gained.
        • -1 if the pet is dead.
        • -2 if the pet is angry.
        • -3 if the command is on cooldown.
